result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan M Vasquez Ramos

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Juan M Vasquez Ramos appeared by video.  Attorney Jacob L Schrinsky appeared by video for Juan M Vasquez Ramos.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. 
Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17. Review Hearing scheduled
Review hearing scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Received and Filed.

Defendant Juan M Vasquez Ramos appeared by video.  Attorney Jacob L Schrinsky appeared by video for Juan M Vasquez Ramos.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for deferred prosecution agreement hearing.
Defense counsel recently received the DPA and parties need time to review.
Case is adjourned for Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Juan M Vasquez Ramos in court.  Attorney Jacob L Schrinsky in court for Juan M Vasquez Ramos.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a deferred prosecution agreement hearing. State needs more information from another agency before going forward with the DPA. Case adjourned.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defense counsel called and also efiled a letter with the Court requesting the 07/11/2022 DPA hearing be rescheduled. Court grants a reschedule of the DPA hearing to 09/16/2022 at 9:00 a.m.
to Court from Jacobson, Schrinksy & Houck Personal Injury Attorneys, filed.

Defendant Juan M Vasquez Ramos in court with attorney Jacob L Schrinsky.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Juan M Vasquez Ramos appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for status conference. Defense requests DPA resolution date. Case adjourned to Branch 30.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Juan M Vasquez Ramos in court with attorney Jacob L Schrinsky.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Juan M Vasquez Ramos appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the state.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case may resolve with a DPA. Case adjourned to Branch 30. Status Conference is scheduled on June 03, 2022 at 08:30am.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Juan M Vasquez Ramos in court with attorney Jacob L Schrinsky.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
